description: The `static_analyzer` subsystem in `CodeBoarding` is a structured pipeline designed to perform high-fidelity semantic analysis of codebases by leveraging the Language Server Protocol (LSP). It transitions from high-level repository state management and language detection to deep, symbol-level extraction, eventually aggregating findings into a unified schema for subsequent AI-driven interpretation.

components.name: Git Lifecycle Manager
components.description: Manages the local lifecycle of the target repository. It handles cloning from remote sources and checking out specific branches to ensure the analyzer operates on a stable, predictable filesystem state.

components.name: Analysis Pipeline Orchestrator
components.description: The central entry point that coordinates the static analysis lifecycle. It sequences the phases from initial filesystem scanning to the execution of language-specific LSP clients, managing the aggregation of all semantic metadata.

components.name: Technology & Volume Profiler
components.description: Utilizes external tools (Tokei) to profile the repository's composition. It identifies the primary programming languages and their relative volumes, which determines which LSP clients should be initialized.

components.name: Semantic Extraction Client (LSP)
components.description: Implements a JSON-RPC client to communicate with Language Servers. It is responsible for starting server processes and querying them for fine-grained symbols, document structures, and call relationships (incoming/outgoing calls).

components.name: Workspace Configuration Resolver
components.description: Specialized scanner for identifying project-level configuration files (like `tsconfig.json`). This allows the system to correctly handle monorepos by identifying internal project boundaries and creating discrete analysis sessions for each.

components.name: Exclusion & Noise Filter
components.description: A centralized manager that interprets `.gitignore` files and hardcoded defaults to exclude dependencies, build artifacts, and hidden directories from the analysis scope, preventing semantic noise.

components.name: Extraction Results Schema
components.description: The primary data container that organizes extracted metadata into a queryable structure. It stores class hierarchies, package dependencies, and Call Graphs (CFG) for use by downstream interpretation agents.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
